embed.description: INVASION, a new Star Guardian themed PvE co-op game mode, will be debuting on the PBE soon! Continue reading for a longer look at the mode, enemies you will face, and more! Here's DefaultChar with an info and feedback thread for the new Star Guardian themed gamemode, Invasion - "Invasion" PvE game mode falling from the stars to PBE soon for testing Hey all!

replies.body: I am so keen to play this mode. and normally I play ranked only.

Remember Butchers Bridge? Awesome new content shoved under the rug? Same thing will happen to this Star Guardian stuff. Not gonna build any attachment to it like I did during Burning Tides.

Sigh... How I miss the Bridge.

This is a personal opinion but I will enjoy the star guardian map way more than the butchers bridge, that was just a reskin this is co op PVE! I loved these kinda games back in the old Warcraft 3 custom map days.

You can read more about butchers bridge here - http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2017/02/ask-riot-where-is-butchers-bridge/
**
Are you guys ever going to bring back the Butcher’s Bridge ARAM map?**

This one is a bit more complex than it seems at first glance. It might look like just an asset swap for the art (take one thing out, drop another thing in), but there’s actually some underlying level scripts, foundation work, etc. that was forked from regular ARAM. This means that Butcher’s Bridge is a unique beast from the code’s point-of-view, even if it looks the same from a player point-of-view.
Bringing it to parity with today’s ARAM (allowing it to be switched on) would require a non-trivial amount of work, and while we’d love to do that, we have to weigh it against the other stuff we’re currently working on, like new game modes and Practice Tool. This isn’t to say Butcher’s Bridge will never return, just that we’re currently more focused on other development priorities.

I agree that the Star Guardian map will be a lot more fun than just a retextured ARAM map. A PvE game is what so many players have been asking for for a long time. 
And I'm dying to try it!

But Im also not fully sold on Riot's answer to Butcher's Bridge.
I feel like if an entire team put in months and months of work into creating it, theres absolutely no chance that **none of them** at all even considered that it might need to be put back into the game at some point, and so didn't bother making any preparations for that.

It's like spending all your money on a brand new car, but just letting it sit in the garage where no one can enjoy it, just because you can't be bothered to walk down the road and get petrol for it. 

Its all very well creating new content, and so ignoring the old stuff, but thats the same argument as "we only give a champ a skin, if it fits the theme." all you end up with is the same champion (like Ezreal, who is so plain that he can fit nearly any theme) getting all the skins. and other champs who have a more specific theme getting none, because none of the existing skin lines work for them, and any new skin lines would only work for them and no other champ, so it's not worth making.

The same will happen with Butchers Bridge, Riot will always be making new content, and so the _"we are focused on making new stuff"_ argument will always apply, and so by the logic, the Bridge will never see the light of day again.

Think of Butchers Bridge like URF. URF isn't new content, however people still prefer it to whatever new game modes come out.
Just because something isn't new and shiny, doesn't mean it isn't worth the 
effort to restore it.

But what I don't understand is how will the Star Guardian maps and modes differ from the Butchers Bridge? If it is a technical nightmare to add the ARAM map to rotation then how much more difficult would it be to add whole extended SG modes?

Or does it ultimatly come down to Riot saying "We'll get around to it one day, but right now look at this new dooby!"

I feel like I want to start a petition poll, but fear that it will just get downvoted into oblivion and buried in a matter of minutes like all my constructive posts.

This.... was unexpected.

and very welcome!
A little disappointed that the 'final boss' isn't Veigar. But minor details! xD

Wow, just wow.
Caaaaaaaan we skip to next patch already plz?

I was hoping the final boss would just be one of the "villain" Arcade champs, not necessarily Veigar. It its a little disappointing, but I really can't wait for some PvE, rather than always being stuck on PvP. I just enjoy PvE so much more, and am so stoked that Riot has finally decided to add it to LoL (in a proper way, not just as "practice").

Can I just sleep through the next fortnight? Is that allowed?

Yea, or even if the normal bosses were still normal, but every now and then you'd get an arcade one. Just because the whole 'boss' thing with arcade, is that they meddle with the code and appear in all different games.

Yea PvE will be amazing, it'll be like the first time Doom Bots was up, and people starting working with their team instead of against them, without all the rage that comes with competitive play.

> Can I just sleep through the next fortnight? Is that allowed?

If this was a thing.....

Although, still waiting for my Star Guardian Taric ;)
I'm still waiting to play Dominions. Been waiting for a couple years on OCE. I played 1000 of them on NA... Not sure why they don't implement them... Still waiting though.
